lcInstruction.p: The sample files for Authoring DITA concept topics are in the zip file concept_samples.zip. Download this file to a location on your hard drive that you’ll remember, then extract the contents to a folder. Where can they find the zip file?I just have the sample files in a folder for now... will update with the final location once we put this on LearnDash.

You will see two versions of each sample file, one with the word "start" added to the end of the filename. Create local copies of the files with "start" and use them to follow the instructions and complete the exercises for each lesson. The introduction to each lesson will tell you which "start" file to use.

Use the sample files without "start" to check your work. If you reach a point where your file doesn’t match the examples, or is broken for any reason, you can make a fresh copy of the "start" file to resume your work or start over.
lcInstruction.ph: In the instructions and examples, we show you the DITA code for each sample file. Most DITA editors have auto-complete or other features to guide you through the process of adding elements, so you will probably not need to create every piece of code from scratch as you work. Our demo videos were created in oXygen XML Editor and show the difference between working in author view and working with the code in text view.
